headline: Meta signs deal to pay Corning up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables, CNBC reports
summary: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has signed ​a deal to pay ‌Gorilla Glass maker Corning up ‌to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables for its AI data centers, CNBC reported on Tuesday. Shares ⁠of Corning ‌jumped more than 7% in premarket trading, ‍while Meta gained marginally. Both the companies did not immediately ​respond to Reuters requests ‌for comment.

content.title: Meta signs deal to pay Corning up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables, CNBC reports
content.summary: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has signed ​a deal to pay ‌Gorilla Glass maker Corning up ‌to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables for its AI data centers, CNBC reported on Tuesday. Shares ⁠of Corning ‌jumped more than 7% in premarket trading, ‍while Meta gained marginally. Both the companies did not immediately ​respond to Reuters requests ‌for comment.

headline: Corning and Meta Announce Multiyear, up to $6 Billion Agreement to Accelerate US Data Center Buildout
summary: CORNING, N.Y., January 27, 2026--Corning Incorporated (NYSE: GLW) and Meta Platforms, Inc. (Nasdaq: META) today announced a multiyear, up to $6 billion agreement to accelerate the buildout of the most advanced data centers in the United States to support Meta’s apps, technologies, and AI ambitions. Under the agreement, Corning will supply Meta with its newest innovations in optical fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions. To support this, Corning will expand manufacturing capabilities across it

content.title: Corning and Meta Announce Multiyear, up to $6 Billion Agreement to Accelerate US Data Center Buildout
content.summary: CORNING, N.Y., January 27, 2026--Corning Incorporated (NYSE: GLW) and Meta Platforms, Inc. (Nasdaq: META) today announced a multiyear, up to $6 billion agreement to accelerate the buildout of the most advanced data centers in the United States to support Meta’s apps, technologies, and AI ambitions. Under the agreement, Corning will supply Meta with its newest innovations in optical fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions. To support this, Corning will expand manufacturing capabilities across it

headline: Pinterest to lay off up to 15% of staff, Corning & Meta cable deal
summary: Health insurers such as UnitedHealth (UNH), Humana (HUM), and CVS (CVS) are trading lower on reports that the Trump administration proposed keeping Medicare rates steady. Pinterest (PINS) shares are slipping on a restructuring plan, and Corning's (GLW) stock is jumping on a deal with Meta (META).Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma reports what's driving the market action.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Pinterest to lay off up to 15% of staff, Corning & Meta cable deal
content.description:
Health insurers such as UnitedHealth (UNH), Humana (HUM), and CVS (CVS) are trading lower on reports that the Trump administration proposed keeping Medicare rates steady. Pinterest (PINS) shares are slipping on a restructuring plan, and Corning's (GLW) stock is jumping on a deal with Meta (META).
Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma reports what's driving the market action.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Pinterest (PINS) shares are slipping on a restructuring plan, and Corning's (GLW) stock is jumping on a deal with Meta (META).Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma reports what's driving the market action.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Meta, Corning sign deal worth up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables in AI data centers
summary: Facebook parent Meta Platforms will pay Gorilla Glass maker Corning up to $6 billion over the next several years in ​a deal to provide fiber-optic cables for its AI data centers, ‌the companies said on Tuesday.  Corning will supply advanced optical fiber, cable and connectivity products to Meta, ‌while expanding its manufacturing capacity in North Carolina, including at its cable factory in Hickory, where Meta will be the anchor customer.  Corning's optical connectivity products are among key components required to support the massive computing and data transmission demands at ⁠data centers.

content.title: Meta, Corning sign deal worth up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables in AI data centers
content.summary: Facebook parent Meta Platforms will pay Gorilla Glass maker Corning up to $6 billion over the next several years in ​a deal to provide fiber-optic cables for its AI data centers, ‌the companies said on Tuesday.  Corning will supply advanced optical fiber, cable and connectivity products to Meta, ‌while expanding its manufacturing capacity in North Carolina, including at its cable factory in Hickory, where Meta will be the anchor customer.  Corning's optical connectivity products are among key components required to support the massive computing and data transmission demands at ⁠data centers.

headline: Corning Stock Jumps on Meta Deal for Data-Center Cables
summary: Shares in Corning surged toward peaks set during the dot-com boom, after the company struck a multiyear deal worth up to $6 billion to sell fiber-optic cable to Meta Platforms.  Corning shares jumped 14% on Tuesday morning, topping $108 a share.

content.title: Corning Stock Jumps on Meta Deal for Data-Center Cables
content.summary: Shares in Corning surged toward peaks set during the dot-com boom, after the company struck a multiyear deal worth up to $6 billion to sell fiber-optic cable to Meta Platforms.  Corning shares jumped 14% on Tuesday morning, topping $108 a share.

headline: Meta Enters Up to $6 Billion Data-Center Fiber-Optic Cable Deal With Corning
summary: Meta has struck a multiyear deal worth up to $6 billion to buy fiber-optic cable from Corning, a move aimed at advancing the expansion of its U.S. data-center network for artificial-intelligence systems.

content.title: Meta Enters Up to $6 Billion Data-Center Fiber-Optic Cable Deal With Corning
content.summary: Meta has struck a multiyear deal worth up to $6 billion to buy fiber-optic cable from Corning, a move aimed at advancing the expansion of its U.S. data-center network for artificial-intelligence systems.
